comments.body: An easier way to implement this would be through advancements or stats. So once the player has earned the â€˜diamondsâ€™ advancement for instance, there is a higher chance of enemies spawning with diamond armour or weapons. This will allow the game to naturally progress in difficulty somewhat.

I have been playing Minecraft for about 8 years and in all that tjme I havenâ€™t found a zombie or skeleton or anything in between that spawn with even just one piece of dimond armor but just dodgy I found one with a chestplate and a helmet and I have come across some raaaaare things but still it is insane how incredibly low even playing on hard how rare this is
i found a full diamonds armor zombie with fire aspect sword on easy mode

Hey, yeah the chances of finding a mob with diamond armor is incredibly rare. I've been playing Minecraft for almost 10 years and today was the first time I actually found and nametagged a babyzombie with diamond armor. If I remember right, it's the first time seeing an naturally spawned piece of a diamond armor. Still can't believe that the babyzombie is full diamond (and leggings entchanted).
However, I think the rarer a mob is the more excitement you get from finding it :)
today i saw a full diamond armour zombie in survival!!ðŸ¤¯

Moved to proper category.

Clarified subject to help search results.

Thanks for your contribution.
I'm bilingual IRL, and this is very funny and a great idea XD
this is a great idea! I think the icons for advancments have to be an item though, im not sure. =D
Great Idea
TL;DR'd your subject line to aid in searching. Less generic, more specific. Hope that helps.

Incredible! This is better than many of the other ideas I've seen, and much better explained to boot. I, personally, am tired of having to jump around, time my left-clicks with my descent, and time my swings with the cooldown all at once. I agree that a decrease in pace would make combat so much more enjoyable, and the startup-recovery frame system is so much more intelligent and atmospheric than the current one. Voted!
I like the combat how it is.

Great idea. I'd say scrap the cooldown altogether and just use your mechanics here.

However, these changes definitely need to apply to mobs too.
Maybe there could also be a shield bash attack (tapping right click as opposed to just holding down) one could perform, that could case a stagger in an opponent if timed right.

There are actually differences between fully charged hits and spam hits/half cooldown hits. That are noticeable to the player and new players.


Weak hits have a sound I would describe as "weak". Whereas, strong fully charged hits either make the critical hit sound, sprint hit sound or sweep attack sound. 

If you turn subtitles on, it literally says "Weak attack" "Critical attack" "Knockback attack" "

Strong attack"

Critical hits deal 1.5 times more damage than normal hits. As a result, it emits particles indicating this.

Mobs emit more dark hearts depending on the amount of damage dealt.

And of course there is the attack indicator and the visible recovery of the weapon in your main hand. Showing how powerful the attack was.

In response to:

"Cooldown issues: heavy and light blows looks the same"

"Players donâ€™t see or hear any difference between the two types of attack, and, as the enemy is constantly pushed back, a new player may think that spamming is the best option."

"To feel powerful, attacks also need a good visual and sound design (clashes and particles on successful hits or stagger, for example)."

Good idea. Bedrock edition uses the old 1.8 java stronghold code, which only spawns 3 strongholds per world and are closer to the center. Did you know a stronghold may not have an end portal? It would be nice if the generation was tweaked a bit, like the strongholds from 1.14 java.

Java also does not have unlimited strongholds; it has 128. But I think that still does not make sense, because strongholds are not a structure to be limited by number, unlike obsidian pillars in the end, the end exit portal, and the gateway portals on the main island. Making the game have infinite strongholds would not mess it up.

Updates to arrows would be sick! 

Thought of a Bat fang the other day and what if you used 1 Bat Fang 1 Bone and 1 feather to make some kind of evil undead like arrow.

The only problem with this suggestion is the following: If diamond arrows have a high retrievable chance it kinda blurs the line of the need to enchant the bow for infinity. Doubt damage values could be increased too, due to also making power either too powerful or again, almost completely unneeded.
Perhaps you could use iron nuggets for arrowheads?
You could make the arrows huge, and be shoot out of giant crossbows.
Ahhhh, the old days.
Yes.
Just play older versions (you can configure it in the launcher).
Just load up an older version.
It would be great to not have to go back to earlier versions; so you can have all the classic stuff but still be in the latest version.

Please listen to them! I belive many people would love it if you made Minecraft a little more nostalgic by bringing back the original music and SFX, original textures, and like they said, something you can buy in the marcetplace that removes all that has been added by Microsoft to get real nostalgic and see the beta days again!
Antonio76000

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360014181032-no-despawning This is also similar, for fans of this idea. (But not so similar that we're going to close this thread.) 

Thanks for your contribution!

Ummm, there's already an option for keeping your inventory.

Just go to cheats in your options and turn on "keep inventory".

Well, unless it's just the hotbar items and nothing else. The I guess it counts as something in the game that doesn't exist.
Yeah keeping your entire inventory isnt the same thing, and this wouldnt and shouldnt be considered cheating
up... I'm looking for a server plugin to do exactly this
Please be more specific because i donâ€™t understand what you are trying to discuss
Yes, this is nowhere near specific enough for the Mojang team to be able to use your ideas.

Hi there, This feedback is incomplete and not really useable by our team in its current form. Since there's no tools, blocks, or items suggested, I'm moving this to general gameplay. Can you explain what you're looking for? Thanks, it will help us express your idea to the team in an actionable way - feel free to edit your original post if needed.
No there should not.  End of story.
Am I at the right place to suggest a crafting recipe?

Iâ€™m usually off for adding more creative ways to do things. However I think if we were to do this it would negate the fact that Minecraft is a simplistic designed game. I think if we added too many ways to craft and create things it could feel as if there was a limitation on once a body can do as they play. The idea is there but there would have to be a limit and really good execution.

We should be able to create a copper golem similar to an iron golem.  The copper golem could defend you from mobs while mining.  A copper golem could also defend a village the way an iron golem does, perhaps in certain biomes.
That's such a cool throwback! I love it when games have easter eggs like that.
I like it! Definitely suits the Warden.
That would be incredible
i agree- especially with the dual weild of a bow n sword to spice things up whilst having a delay- it would help stop auto clickers with 1million cps
This is something that really needs to be addressed, as the Legacy Console Editions fixed this issue. In those versions, you were able to have your sensitivity up to 200%.
Like it but can we see some new mobs with it like ones that are Extinct

I really like this idea, it might also make an improvement if you slowly started to freeze and had to go inside a building to warm up
This would make it more fun to try! Would you earn the same amount of minecoins as you earn gamerscore?

Yes definitely. Or if we level up on servers such as cubecraft we get minecoins. Or for achievements such as beating the game

Mods are a feature made by the community using 3rd party software.
You can use behaviour and resource packs to make mods on console do, there are plenty of tutorials on youtube how to.

Or just use the marketplace.
Oh, and you always get critical hits while on horseback
I think steam engines would be too industrial for Minecraft. We already have minecarts and boats!
Minecart + Furnace... but they could add a boat + furnace. A kind of airship might work... I doubt it, though. I like it the way it is, though the boat + furnace would be a nice addition.
